summary: This is an email from a Financial Program Specialist at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding a delay in receiving fiber cable for camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The email discusses procurement issues and is marked as sensitive information belonging to the US Department of Justice.

persons.name: Financial Program Specialist
persons.context: Author of the email, works for the United States Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Comp. Tech
persons.context: Advised the Financial Program Specialist that they haven't been able to receive the Fiber Cable and cannot proceed with the Camera Systems without it.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional CTR, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated April 1, 2019, concerning procurement delays for camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The delay is due to an inability to receive Fiber Cable, which is required to proceed with the Camera Systems.
The email is marked as sensitive information belonging to the US Department of Justice and warns against unauthorized distribution.
The document originates from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, specifically the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
